params.note: Protocol for characterizing cell composition in 1- and 5-month-old human brain organoids using scRNA-seq data from the Human Organoid Single-Cell Browser.

Region-specific gene markers: Mesencephalon (EN1, EN2, FOXA2), Metencephalon (IRX3, PTF1A, GBX2, ATOH1), Diencephalon (GBX2, LHX9, LHX1), Pons (PAX3, PHOX2A, DBH), Hypothalamus (OPT, TBX3, POMC), Myelencephalon (HOXA2, HOXB2, KROX20), Epithalamus (DBX1, IRX1), Subthalamus (LMX1A), Spinal Cord progenitors, Optic Cup (VSX2, RAX, CHX10), Telencephalon (FOXG1, SIX3, LMO4, AUTS2), Pallium (EMX2, PAX6, LHX2, NEUROD2, EOMES), Subpallium (GSX2, ASCL1, DLX1, DLX2, SALL3, MEIS2, PBX3, NKX2.1, NKX2.2, LHX6, OLIG2, NR2F2, HTR3A).
Neural progenitor (NP) expression levels: NP1 (pct.exp), NP2 (0.25), NP3 (0.50), NP4 (0.75), NP5 (1.00).
Inhibitory neuron (IN) and excitatory neuron (EN) expression levels: IP-IN avg.exp (1.00), IP-EN (0.75), IN1 (0.50), IN2 (0.25), IN3 (0), IN4, IN5; EN1, EN2, EN3.

Gene list includes: GATA4, GATA6, TBXT, HAND1, OTX2, SOX1, FOXG1, SIX3, LMO4, AUTS2, EMX2, PAX6, LHX2, NEUROD2, EOMES, GSX2, ASCL1, DLX1, DLX2, SALL3, MEIS2, PBX3, NKX2.1, NKX2.2, LHX6, OLIG2, NR2F2, HTR3A, GBX2, SOX14, GATA3, POU4F, OPT, TBX3, POMC, DBX1, IRX1, LMX1A, VSX2, RAX, CHX10, EN1, EN2, FOXA2, EVX1, PAX5, PAX2, PAX8, IRX3, PTF1A, ATOH1, PAX3, PHOX2A, DBH, HOXA2, HOXB2, KROX20, HOXA1, HOXB1, HOXB4, HOXB6, HOXC5.
5-month-old organoid cell types: Mural/Ependymal (0.25), Astrocytes (0.50), OPC (0.75), Mural/Ependymal (1.00).
Gene expression in 5-month-old organoids: RG-CTX IN-LGE avg.exp (1.00), IP-IN (0.75), EN-CTX-Superficial (0.50), EN-CTX-Deep (0.25), IP-EN (0), nIN, nEN1, nEN2.

Top autism and schizophrenia-associated genes: RBFOX3, FEZF2, SATB2, GAD1, AQP4, S100B, SYN1, DLG4, BDNF, OSTN, SCN2A, SYNGAP1, GRIN2B, ADNP, CHD8, KMT2A, SETD1A, CUL1, XPO7, TRIO, CACNA1G, SP4, GRIA3, GRIN2A, HERC1, RB1CC1.
UMAP visualization of cell type composition in 1- and 5-month-old organoids using Human Organoid Single-Cell Browser (http://organoid.chpc.utah.edu).
pct.exp: percentage of cells within a cell cluster expressing a specific gene; avg.exp: average expression level.
Data source: Rolland et al., 2023 (autism); Singh et al., 2022 (schizophrenia).
